title: Verify that the Scoreboard flips to the next day at 3 AM EST as long as the season isn't over
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And that the season isn't over
And the time is before 3 AM EST
custom_steps: When the time hits 3 AM EST
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard will flip to the next day

title: Setting device to different timezones (Eastern, Central, Mountain & Pacific) will allow it to reflect games correctly for that timezone.  If it falls outside those timezones it will then default to Eastern
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard
And there are games on the Scoreboard that haven't been played yet
custom_steps:
When we set the devices timezone to Eastern (ET)
And we set the devices timezone to Central (CT)
And we set the devices timezone to Mountain (MT)
And we set the devices timezone to Pacific (PT)
And we set the devices timezone to one outside the above range
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard will display the games in the appropriate time from the appropriate time zone

title: Games will be sorted by game state and chronological order
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are some games completed
And there are some games in progress
And there are some games not started as of yet
And the user doesn't have a Favorite Team set
custom_expected:
Then the games will be sorted by game state with the finished games at the bottom
And the games not started will be sorted by the time of that particular game above the finished games
And the games in progress will be sorted by the time of that particular game above the finished games

title: Favorite Team's game will always remain at the top regardless of the state of that particular game
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And the user has a Favorite Team set
custom_expected: Then the top game on the Scoreboard will always be the Favorite Team's game no matter the state of that particular game

title: Favorite Team will have a star next to it's name
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And the user has set a Favorite Team
custom_expected: Then the Favorite Team will appear on the Scoreboard with a star to the left of it's name

title: Multiple Favorite teams will all have the star to the left of their name on the Scoreboard indicating that they are a favorite team
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard
And we have multiple Favorite Teams selected
custom_expected: Then all Favorite Teams that have been selected will have a star to the left of their name indicating that they are a favorite team

title: Multiple Favorite teams will display in the order that they were originally set to by the user in settings
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have multiple Favorite Teams set
custom_expected: Then the multiple favorite teams will display on the scoreboard in the order that they were set as favorite teams

title: Text and game state formatting on games should be clear and readable
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are games present on the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all text and game state formatting will be clear & readable

title: Games displayed on the Scoreboard have the correct Inning, Score and Base Runner Indicator shown
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games in progress
custom_expected:
Then the games displayed are showing the correct inning
And the games displayed are showing the correct score
And the games displayed are showing the correct base runner indicator

title: Tapping a game cell on the Scoreboard expands that games cell
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we tap on a game cell that isn't expanded
custom_expected: Then that game cell will expand

title: On an Expanded Game Cell if the game hasn't started yet then we will see team logos, records, game start time, field name and ticket button
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games present on the Scoreboard
And we have tapped on one of the game cells that is in a preview state to expand it
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the team logos are visible
And that the team records are visible
And that the game start time is visible
And that the field name is visible

title: On an Expanded Game Cell if the game has started then we will see a linescore, gameday button, video button, and box score button
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games present on the Scoreboard
And we have tapped on one of the game cells that is in an in progress state to expand it
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the linescore is visible
And that the gameday button is visible
And that the box score button is visible
And that the video button is visible

title: On an Expanded Game Cell if the game is in a final state then we will see a linescore, gameday button, box score button, and video button present
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games present on the Scoreboard
And we have tapped on one of the game cells that is in a final state to expand it
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the linescore is visible
And that the gameday button is visible
And that the box score button is visible
And that the video button is visible

title: Games on the Scoreboard will update their state, score and scheduling automatically depending on the Update Frequency set in the Settings menu
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have games appearing on that date
custom_expected: Then the games in question will update their state, score and scheduling automatically depending on what the Update Frequency is set to in the Settings menu

title: Changing the Update Frequency setting in Settings will allow the Scoreboard to refresh at that new rate
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we change the Update Frequency setting under the Settings menu
custom_expected:
Then the Scoreboard will refresh according to the Update Frequency that has been set

REPEAT for each Update Frequency setting

title: All team names and logos appear correctly and up to date
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_expected:
Then all team names & logos appear correctly & up to date
And team logos appear correctly in retina & non-retina devices

title: Day to Day Navigation works forward and backwards
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And the day we are at is not the first day season
Or the day we are at is not the last day of the season
custom_steps:
When we tap the forward navigation buttons
Or we tap the backwards navigation buttons
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard updates to the appropriate date

title: Date Navigation is bound to the appropriate season
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we know the bound dates are 9/1/2012 - 3/30/13
custom_expected:
Then we can't navigate earlier then the beginning of the season
And we can't navigate past the ending of the season

title: Verify that the Scoreboard season end date can be extended and that we can then navigate to that new date
custom_preconds:
Given we have configuration assistance by someone who can change it
And that person has changed the season end date
And we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_expected: Then we can navigate to that new season end date

title: The linescore detail appears correctly for games currently in progress, finalized, completed early and/or completed with extra innings
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we select a game in a particular state
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the game state is correct
And that the win loss records are correct
And that the innings displayed are correct
And that the runs per innings are correct
And that the runs are correct
And that the hits are correct
And that the errors are correct
And that the winning pitcher is correct if the game is finalized
And that the losing pitcher is correct if the game is finalized

REPEAT for each Game State

title: When a game has Extra Innings all innings are scrollable on the linescore
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have found a game that has extra innings
And we have expanded that games cell
custom_expected: Then we can navigate back & forth between all the innings on the linescore

title: Scoreboard will update immediately when application is brought to the foreground after being in the background
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have sent the application to the background
And we have brought the application back to the foreground
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard will update immediately

title: The Scoreboard will default back to Today if it's brought back to the foreground after being backgrounded for more than an hour
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have set it's date to another day
And we have sent the application to the background
And the application has been in the background for at least an hour
And we have then brought the application to the foreground
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard will appear on Today's date

title: On a day with no games a web view stating No Scheduled Games will be present
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have found a date with no games being played
custom_expected: Then a web view stating No Scheduled Games will be visible

title: Home teams are always listed after Away teams
custom_preconds: Given there is a game scheduled for that date
custom_steps:
When the user open up the app 
And go to the scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then you will see:
- the home team listed underneath the away team
- when you tap the game, the away team is listed on the left and the home team to the right

title: User can swipe left and right on scoreboard page
custom_preconds:
Given the app as been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard screen
custom_steps: When the user swipes left or right on the scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard should move forward or backward one day according to the direction the user swiped

title: Verify that when a game has been completed early that it's displayed as 'Final/n'
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scoreboard
And there is a game available that has been 'Completed Early'
custom_expected: Then the game that has been 'Completed Early' will read as 'Final/n' instead of mentioning 'Completed Early'

title: Verify that we can swipe between days on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scoreboard
And we attempt to swipe left
Or we attempt to swipe right
custom_expected: Then we will be able to swipe successfully to another day

title: Verify that the Scoreboard will not refresh to the current day when the user is on another day
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to another day on the Scoreboard
And we select the Video Tab from a completed game
And we start up an Archived Game
And we close the Archived Game down
And we move back to the Scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then we will remain on the appropriate day on the Scoreboard
And we will not be reset to 'Today'

title: Verify that the Scoreboard won't get stuck between days if the user suddenly hits a button while transitioning between days
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scoreboard
And we navigate between days
And we tap on a Tab Bar button to switch off gameday while between the days
And we tap on the Scoreboard Tab Bar button again
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard will NOT be stuck between days

title: Verify that opening the last cell on the iPhone scoreboard doesn't display a funky fresh animation
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scoreboard
And we open up the 'Last Cell' on the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then their will be NO funky fresh animation displayed

title: Verify that if we background the application and bring it back that the Scoreboard is performing a silent refresh
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scorebaord
And we background the Application
And we bring the Application back
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the Scoreboard refreshes silently
And we will see that the Scoreboard will not appear to clear itself before it refreshes itself

title: Verify if we background the application and come back after an hour that the Scoreboard updates appropriately
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scoreboard
And we background it for an hour
And we bring the application back up
custom_expected: Then it will update appropriately

title: The number of games on each day will match the number of games listed on the calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the Date at the top of the scoreboard screen
custom_expected:
Then the Calendar picker will appear
And the number of games listed on each date in the calendar should match the number of games scheduled for that date.

title: When tapping on the date then a calendar picker will appear
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When we tap on the date in the top of the scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the Calendar picker appears

title: User scrolls left and right on Calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the Calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user swipes left and right on the calendar
custom_expected: Then the calendar should flip to show the newly selected month.

title: User taps forward and back arrows on calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the Calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user taps left or right on the calendar
custom_expected: Then the calendar should adjust and show the newly selected month.

title: User scrolls using month scroll bar on bottom of calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user scrolls left and right along the bottom scroll bar
custom_expected: Then the month selected should quickly adjust as the user slides back and forth

title: User selects a date in the Calendar
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has launched the calendar picker
custom_steps: When the user selects a date on the calendar picker
custom_expected:
Then the calendar picker should disappear
And the user should be taken back to the scoreboard page
And the date that the user is left on should be the newly selected date

title: User taps 'Today' button in Calendar picker
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
And the user is on a date that is different than today's date
custom_steps:
When the user taps the Date in the top of the scoreboard
And the user taps the 'Today' button in the top of the calendar picker
custom_expected:
Then the calendar picker should disappear
And the user should be brought to the scoreboard page
And the date the user is on should be 'Todays' date

title: Date that user has selected matches date on calendar
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the Date at the top of the scoreboard page
custom_expected:
Then the calendar picker should appear
And the date that the user has selected should appear selected in the calendar picker.

custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are some games completed
And there are some games in progress
And there are some games not started as of yet
And the user doesn't have a Favorite Team set
custom_expected:
Then the games will be sorted by game state with the finished games at the bottom
And the games not started will be sorted by the time of that particular game above the finished games
And the games in progress will be sorted by the time of that particular game above the finished games

title: Favorite Team's game will always remain at the top regardless of the state of that particular game
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And the user has a Favorite Team set
custom_expected: Then the top game on the Scoreboard will always be the Favorite Team's game no matter the state of that particular game

title: Favorite Team will have a star next to it's name
custom_preconds:
Given the user has selected the Scoreboard menu
And the user has set a Favorite Team
custom_expected: Then the Favorite Team will appear on the Scoreboard with a star to the right of it's name

title: Text and game state information and formatting are clear and readable
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are games present on the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all text & game state formatting will be clear & readable

title: Scoreboard: Utilizing the menu buttons on the top we are able to navigate to all other parts of the application from the Scoreboard
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we tap each menu item on the top
custom_expected: Then we are able to navigate to all other parts of the application from the Scoreboard

title: Scoreboard: Changing the Refresh Rate setting in Settings will allow the Scoreboard to refresh at that new rate
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When we change the Refresh Rate under the Settings menu
custom_expected:
Then the Scoreboard will refresh according to the Refresh Rate that has been set

REPEAT for each Refresh Rate

title: Scoreboard: All team names and logos appear correctly an up to date
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_expected: Then all team names & logos appear correctly an up to date

title: Scoreboard: The number of games in the top date picker will match the number of games shown on the scoreboard for that day
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
custom_steps: When the user taps the Date in the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the number of games for each date in the calendar should match the number of games shown on the scoreboard for that day

title: Scoreboard: Selecting a particular day on the Scoreboard will update the Scoreboard to that day's games
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have opened up the date picker
custom_steps: When a particular day is tapped
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard updates to the particular day

title: Scoreboard: Day to Day Navigation works forward and backwards
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And the day we are at is not the first day season
Or the day we are at is not the last day of the season
custom_steps:
When we swipe the forward navigation buttons
Or backwards navigation buttons
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard updates to the appropriate date

title: Scoreboard: Verify that selecting the calendar on the top brings up a calendar and then selecting a date updates the scoreboard to that particular dates games if there are any
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
custom_steps:
When we tap the calendar on the top
And select a date on it
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard updates to that particular dates games if there are any

title: Scoreboard: When viewing a scheduled game tile it will show the game time and projected starters for it
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And there are games on the scoreboard that haven't started yet
custom_expected:
Then the game time will be visible
And the projected starters will be visible

title: Scoreboard: When tapping on a scheduled game tile it will bring up a preview for that particular game
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And there are games on the scoreboard that haven't started yet
custom_steps: When we tap on a scheduled game tile
custom_expected:
Then we will see a preview for that particular game
and that the preview URL is http://wapqa.mlb.com/<game_id_with_underscores_not_dashes>/ipadpregame/v2?mode=tabloid

title: Scoreboard: When a game state is in progress then the updated linescore information will be visible on that game tile
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And the Scoreboard contains games currently in a state of in progress
custom_expected: Then the linescore will show the correct & up to date information for that particular game

title: Scoreboard: When a game state is in progress and we select that game tile we will then see the Box Score, Gameday and Highlights tabs
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And the scoreboard displays games in a state of in progress
custom_steps: When we tap on a game tile of a game in progress
custom_expected:
Then the Box Score tab will be visible
And the Gameday tab will be visible
And the Highlights tab will be visible

title: Scoreboard: When a game has gone final then we will see the final linescore, winning pitcher and losing pitcher on the game tile
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And there are games in a final state
custom_expected:
Then the final linescore will be visible
and the winning pitcher will be visible
and the losing pitcher will be visible

title: Scoreboard: When a game has gone final and we tap on the game tile then we will see the wrap, box score and any highlights for that particular game
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And there are games in a final state
custom_steps: When we tap on a final state game tile
custom_expected:
Then the wrap will be visible
and the highlights will be visible
and the box score will be visible

title: Scoreboard: When an Extra Innings game tile is tapped then the linescore that appears is scrollable so all innings can be seen
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And we have found a day with an extra inning game
custom_steps: When we tap the extra inning game
custom_expected: Then we can scroll the linescore & see all innings of that particular game

title: Scoreboard: Home teams are always listed after the away team
custom_preconds: Given there is a game scheduled for that date
custom_steps:
When the user open up the app
And go to the scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then the user will see:
- on the game tile you will see the home team listed underneath the away team
- Active game the user will see in the line score that the home team listed underneath the away team
- Game in preview home team will be listed to the right and the away team to the left

title: Scoreboard: Verify that when a game has been completed early that it's displayed as 'Final/n'
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed World Baseball Classic
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Scoreboard
AND there is a game available that has been 'Completed Early'
custom_expected: THEN the game that has been 'Completed Early' will read as 'Final/n' instead of mentioning 'Completed Early'

title: Scoreboard: On a day with no games a web view stating No Scheduled Games will be present
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the Scoreboard menu
And we have found a date with no games being played
custom_expected: Then a web view stating No Scheduled Games will be visible
